titlestmt.author: Collection processed and described by Rebecca Pou

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Rebecca Pou, March 1, 2011.

repository.corpname: New York Academy of Medicine Library. Rare Book Room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Riverside Practioners' Society Records. Rare Book Room, New York Academy of Medicine Library.

bioghist.p: The Riverside Practioners' Society formed in 1900 with the dual purpose of acquiring medical and surgical knowledge and providing a social forum for its members. Membership was restricted to regular practitioners residing in the Riverside neighborhood of Manhattan, defined as west of Central Park from the north side of 59th street and the south side of 110th street. Regular meetings were held monthly (except in June, July, August, and September) and generally consisted of presentations, the reading of papers, discussions, and executive business. The activity of the Society after 1939 is unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes the Society's constitution and by-laws, minutes (1900-1939), a photo album from the 300th anniversary meeting and dinner, and a copy of the "Good Old Ballads of the Riverside Practitioners Society." Additional materials such as meeting announcements, programs, and photographs are interspersed within the minutes.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of The New York Academy of Medicine Library. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.subject: Medicine -- New York (State) -- New York -- Societies, etc.
